comment.body: May I suggest reverting (removing) this addition again as a) it's failing on `main` and b) [didn't we agree that Travis (and the platforms it tests) are no "mainline" targets until they deliver the same level of testing as CCI](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1037#issuecomment-870345003)?

pull_request.title: TravisCI for ppc64le and suppression file update for Dilithium
pull_request.body:
(1)
Simple TravisCI integration for ppc64le

(2)
Minor suppression file update for Dilithium after a constant-time check on ppc64le (see https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1037):
(i) two line numbers changed, (ii) using explicit function name (fun:rej_uniform) for generic Dilithium

The CI log with reports is available here: [ppc64le.txt](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/files/6733709/ppc64le.txt)

The SPHINCS+ reports are documented separately in #1038.

The reported issues (except #1038) should also be reproducible using the `constant-time-x64-extensions` / `constant-time-x64` circleci jobs. After this fix, the constant-time checks pass on x86_64 / ppc64le, except BIKE that will have to be handled separately.

<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

comment.body:
Do you suggest to revert the travis build (travis config file), or only the Travis build icon in the readme?
To a) The build will pass once #1037 is merged
To b) My thought was to enable the simple travis build for ppc64le (on main), but don't advertise the platform as "fully supported" until full CCI is integrated, I might have misunderstood it though. In the meanwhile I see the travis build mainly as an additional test to check if libOQS builds and which can be useful to detect things like #1038.

comment.body: No, the test shall remain: I'd have argued for the icon to go -- but if it's turning green on merge of #1037 I'm fine. Begs the question what's missing for merging #1037? I thought #1049 has been created to allow us to merge #1037? Right @dstebila ?

comment.body:
> No, the test shall remain: I'd have argued for the icon to go -- but if it's turning green on merge of #1037 I'm fine. Begs the question what's missing for merging #1037? I thought #1049 has been created to allow us to merge #1037? Right @dstebila ?

I'd just been waiting for the builds to finish on #1037, which they now have, so I've merged #1037.  We might as well keep the Travis icon since it's there, even though we're not officially advertising support for ppc64le yet.  And for our dev team, you can always see the full table of all our build icons at https://openquantumsafe.org/dashboard.html.
